channel.title: Does anyone else realize?
channel.description:
Okay, so I'm thinking right now that all of moparscape has no creativity whatsoever. It's safe to say that since '08 summer, no one has changed the feel to an average server source. You're all spamming npcs to make training so incredibly convenient that it's not even an accomplishment. You're allowing users to have access to rares like they're candy on halloween (you're giving them out basically). And you're completely abolishing the concept of achieving anything all together. You're homes have no thought to them, you have 35 shops in one place, and Allstars hammer is still 9999999 strength.
With the exception that my last source release was Reapagescape V2 in [b]JULY OF '08[/b] mind you, I was only starting off. It was literally my first week into coding and had no clue what essentials were needed. But in the end, I did establish a fun and creative server. When I look at the downloads section, I see the same source. I'd like to understand that you're all only starting out like I did, but if you notice the titles... They're V4s and V5s. By then you should get the point.
I suppose this is just one way of venting, but more importantly a way to get moparscape on track. I know a lot of you probably didn't read half of this post, but I'm challenging all of you to thrive to greater expectations. Why don't I do anything you ask? Because I've been gone for like 3 months. So, if you get what I'm saying, try your hardest to not to anything that I've recognized in the past years worth of downloads. It's just repetitive and dissapointing. You could call me a hypocrite, but that wouldn't be helping anything.
Voice your opinions as well, I'm sure there are some of you that see the same.

item.title: Does anyone else realize?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote="_™, post:44, topic:286955"]It’s said, Moparisthebest, because people of this community have the capabilities, but don’t use their knowledge. Together, the smartest people of your community could make what you’re looking for.[/quote]To be honest, and not a steriotypical moparscaper bagging on mitb members, the smartest people are ones who don’t care about private servers. (the only person i can give an exception to is ry60003333). They’re all over at mitb doing things that don’t concern RS Private Servers at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Does anyone else realize?
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:43, topic:286955”][quote author=jensie link=topic=379492.msg2858073#msg2858073 date=1247000678]
Well, there could be a “official Moparscape server”. A few people should (if possible) work at it, and it should run for a while. That way, I guess everyone here will check it/play it some time.
After a certain amount of time (no clue how long), release the server and ANYONE here will use it.

That’s what happened with Delta.
[/quote]

I would run one if there was one that was stable, I refuse to run any ‘server’ that is so crappy it requires an ‘auto-restarter’ and crashes on bad client connections.

I just find it annoying and I cant understand why people would want to go through 8 folders to get to one file there must be a way they do it that we dont know about.

IDEs aren’t really a big secret I didn’t think, my personal favorite is netbeans which you can download for free and program in.[/quote]

Thanks Mopar imma download it now and see what its like.

Read full topic

item.title: Does anyone else realize?
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:43, topic:286955”][quote author=jensie link=topic=379492.msg2858073#msg2858073 date=1247000678]
Well, there could be a “official Moparscape server”. A few people should (if possible) work at it, and it should run for a while. That way, I guess everyone here will check it/play it some time.
After a certain amount of time (no clue how long), release the server and ANYONE here will use it.

That’s what happened with Delta.
[/quote]

I would run one if there was one that was stable, I refuse to run any ‘server’ that is so crappy it requires an ‘auto-restarter’ and crashes on bad client connections.[/quote]

It’s sad, Moparisthebest, because people of this community have the capabilities, but don’t use their knowledge. Together, the smartest people of your community could make what you’re looking for.

Read full topic

item.title: Does anyone else realize?
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

Tatemo:

I just find it annoying and I cant understand why people would want to go through 8 folders to get to one file there must be a way they do it that we dont know about.

It’s called Java Conventions.

This Code Conventions for the Java Programming Language document contains the standard conventions that we at Sun follow and recommend that others follow. It covers [b]filenames, file organization[/b], indentation, comments, declarations, statements, white space, naming conventions, programming practices and includes a code example.

Read full topic

item.title: Does anyone else realize?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest

@moparisthebest wrote:

If it is written correctly, they will be forced to use the ‘extensible part’, and not copy/paste.

item.title: Does anyone else realize?
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Not releasing open source is a horrible idea, not to mention the fact that it isn’t safe at all and I would advise people to never run code released like that. Adding content before releasing would be a good way to go though.

The main reason I said that was because what people would do is hard code everything into the framework instead of using the extensible part (like making plugins). So what I mean is to have some way to control what people do with the framework.

The problem is all the people who do get things done don’t release them.

Read full topic

item.title: Does anyone else realize?
item.dc:creator: @cows1471 cows1471
item.description:
@cows1471 wrote:

Heres some handy stuff:

  1. dont use allstar/servers like allstar
  2. dont be formal with training
  3. dont put shops together

easy - problem solved

Read full topic

item.title: Does anyone else realize?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:21, topic:286955”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=379492.msg2854899#msg2854899 date=1246771415]
Sure most people come here originally to leech, but some of them stay to learn, which is the entire point.

I think everyone realizes this, most private servers I see are the exact same as winterlove’s original release in 2005 except that instead of a 20 line switch statement it has turned into a 3000 line switch statement and it’s buggier than ever, also as stated above many great ‘frameworks’ have been created but have no content and therefore will never be used. Anyone have any suggestions on fixing the problem?
[/quote]

Add the content before releasing. And maybe release binaries instead of open source. Also provide a way to extend the servers functionality, such as plugins.[/quote]

Not releasing open source is a horrible idea, not to mention the fact that it isn’t safe at all and I would advise people to never run code released like that. Adding content before releasing would be a good way to go though.

Read full topic

It will fix the problem real fast.[/quote]
